newsitem.title: LEBANON: Bank shares up, Solidere mixed in Beirut.
newsitem.headline: Bank shares up, Solidere mixed in Beirut.

text.p: Bank shares rose on the Beirut Stock Exchange on Tuesday as Banque Audi shares went up to $17.25 from $17.125 and Banque Libanaise pour le Commerce rose to $12.625 from $12.5.
Solidere shares were mixed with A shares steady at $10.5 and B shares down to $10.875 from $11.
Turnover in Audi was 40,414 shares from Monday's 35,785 shares. Tuesday's deals included a block trade of 20,000 Audi shares traded inside the bourse floor at $17.125 for a value of $342,500.
A total of 41,000 BLC shares -- including a bloc of 15,000 shares changing hands at $12.375 outside the floor -- were traded on Tuesday against 26,500 shares on Monday.
There was no trade in the four other listed firms: Ciments Libanais, Ciments Blancs, Uniceramic and Eternit.
The BSE also announced on Tuesday a bloc trade of 3,108,307 Ciments Libanais shares traded at $1.5481 outside the floor on February 12.
According to BSE laws, brokers must declare any such transactions within six days from the day of execution.
Total BSE turnover was 138,035 shares from 151,887 for a value of $1,783,060 against $1,907,289 on Monday.
The LISPI stock index rose 0.06 percent to 81.66
